<project title="A2A" summary="The A2A Protocol aims to unify AI agents by providing a standardized communication framework that allows them to discover each other, negotiate interaction modes, collaborate on long-running tasks, and exchange data securely—all without exposing proprietary internals. It seeks to break down vendor silos, enable complex multi-agent workflows, promote open standards, and support enterprise-grade security and observability. The project is designed for broad adoption across AI ecosystems, with SDKs available in multiple languages and a growing community of contributors.">**Remember:**
- Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol
- Agent Cards
- JSON-RPC 2.0 over HTTP(S)
- Agent Discovery
- Flexible Interaction Modalities (text, streaming, async)
- Opaque Agent Collaboration<docs><doc title="README" desc="install &amp; quickstart.">

    <path d="M1.5 1.75V13.5h13.75a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.5H.75a.75.75 0 0 1-.75-.75V1.75a.75.75 0 0 1 1.5 0Zm14.28 2.53-5.25 5.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0L7 7.06 4.28 9.78a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042l3.25-3.25a.75.75 0 0 1 1.06 0L10 7.94l4.72-4.72a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042Z"></path>
</svg>
        </span>
      
        <span data-view-component="true" class="ActionListItem-label">
          Insights
</span>      
</a>
  
</li>
</ul>    
</div></action-list>


</div>
      
</div></anchored-position>  </focus-group>
</action-menu></div>
</nav>

  <h2 class="sr-only">Navigation Menu</h2>

  <button type="button" class="HeaderMktg-backdrop d-lg-none border-0 position-fixed top-0 left-0 width-full height-full js-details-target" aria-label="Toggle navigation">
    <span class="d-none">Toggle navigation</span>

  <div class="d-flex flex-column flex-lg-row flex-items-center px-3 px-md-4 px-lg-5 height-full position-relative z-1">
    <div class="d-flex flex-justify-between flex-items-center width-full width-lg-auto">

        <span class="js-stale-session-flash-switched" hidden>You switched accounts on another tab or window. <a class="Link--inTextBlock" href="">Reload</a> to refresh your session.</span>

    <button id="icon-button-a22b331e-538b-45f6-b7b9-aa64fa953063" aria-labelledby="tooltip-bc631dde-845c-49fb-a268-393ec19dbffa" type="button" data-view-component="true" class="Button Button--iconOnly Button--invisible Button--medium flash-close js-flash-close">  <svg aria-hidden="true" height="16" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" data-view-component="true" class="octicon octicon-x Button-visual">

    </div>

</button><tool-tip id="tooltip-c2bfd94c-838c-46a2-bae3-a31cf1424fba" for="icon-button-b1a406fe-f58d-4e4c-a2bc-4501bb05ab73" popover="manual" data-direction="s" data-type="label" data-view-component="true" class="sr-only position-absolute">Appearance settings</tool-tip>

using the SDK.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHow Agent Skills and Agent Cards describe an agent.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHow an A2A server handles tasks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHow to interact with an A2A server using a client.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHow streaming capabilities and multi-turn interactions work.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHow an LLM can be integrated into an A2A agent.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy the end of this tutorial, you will have a functional understanding of A2A agents and a solid foundation for building or integrating A2A-compliant applications.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eTutorial 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe tutorial is broken down into the following steps:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/tutorials/python/1-introduction.md\"\u003eIntroduction (This Card\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e: Define what your agent can do and how it describes itself.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/tutorials/python/4-agent-executor.md\"\u003eThe Agent Executor\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e: Understand how the agent logic is implemented.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/tutorials/python/5-start-server.md\"\u003eStarting the agent.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/tutorials/python/7-streaming-and-multiturn.md\"\u003eStreaming \u0026amp; Multi-Turn A2A.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eLet's get do (its skills) and how other agents or clients can find out about these capabilities (its Agent Card).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe'll use the \u003ccode\u003ehelloworld\u003c/code\u003e example located in \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/tree/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ea2a-samples/samples/python/agents/helloworld/\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eAgent Skills\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-agent-skills\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Agent Skills\" href=\"#agent-skills\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAn \u003cstrong\u003eAgent Skill\u003c/strong\u003e describes a specific capability or function the agent can perform. It's a building block that tells clients what kinds of tasks the agent is good for.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eKey attributes of an \u003ccode\u003eAgentSkill\u003c/code\u003e (defined in \u003ccode\u003ea2a.types\u003c/code\u003e):\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e: A unique identifier for the skill.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e: A human-readable name.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003edescription\u003c/code\u003e: A more detailed explanation of what the skill does.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etags\u003c/code\u003e: Keywords for categorization and discovery.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eexamples\u003c/code\u003e: Sample prompts or use cases.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003einputModes\u003c/code\u003e / \u003ccode\u003eoutputModes\u003c/code\u003e: Supported Media Types for input and output (e.g., \"text/plain\", \"application/json\").\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003e__main__.py\u003c/code\u003e, you can see how a skill for the Helloworld agent is defined:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/__main__.py:AgentSkill\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/__main__.py:AgentSkill\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis skill is very simple: it's named \"Returns hello world\" and primarily deals with text.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eAgent Card\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-agent-card\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Agent Card\" href=\"#agent-card\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003cstrong\u003eAgent Card\u003c/strong\u003e is a JSON document that an A2A Server makes available, typically at a \u003ccode\u003e.well-known/agent-card.json\u003c/code\u003e endpoint. It's like a digital business card for the agent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eKey attributes of an \u003ccode\u003eAgentCard\u003c/code\u003e (defined in \u003ccode\u003ea2a.types\u003c/code\u003e):\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edescription\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eversion\u003c/code\u003e: Basic identity information.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eurl\u003c/code\u003e: The endpoint where the A2A service can be reached.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecapabilities\u003c/code\u003e: Specifies supported A2A features like \u003ccode\u003estreaming\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003epushNotifications\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003edefaultInputModes\u003c/code\u003e / \u003ccode\u003edefaultOutputModes\u003c/code\u003e: Default Media Types for the agent.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eskills\u003c/code\u003e: A list of \u003ccode\u003eAgentSkill\u003c/code\u003e objects that the agent offers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003ehelloworld\u003c/code\u003e example defines its Agent Card like this:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/__main__.py:AgentCard\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/__main__.py:AgentCard\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis card tells us the agent is named \"Hello World Agent\", runs at \u003ccode\u003ehttp://localhost:9999/\u003c/code\u003e, supports text interactions, and has the \u003ccode\u003ehello_world\u003c/code\u003e skill. It also indicates public authentication, meaning no specific credentials are required.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUnderstanding the Agent Card is crucial because it's how a client discovers an agent and learns how to interact with it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/article\u003e","renderedFileInfo":null,"shortPath":null,"symbolsEnabled":true,"tabSize":4,"topBannersInfo":{"overridingGlobalFundingFile":false,"globalPreferredFundingPath":null,"showInvalidCitationWarning":false,"citationHelpUrl":"https://docs.github.com/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/creating-a-repository-on-github/about-citation-files","actionsOnboardingTip":null},"truncated":false,"viewable":true,"workflowRedirectUrl":null,"symbols":{"timed_out":false,"not_analyzed":false,"symbols":[{"name":"3.     <path d="M13.78 4.22a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-7.25 7.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0L2.22 9.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018L6 10.94l6.72-6.72a.75.75 0 0 1 1.06 0Z"></path>

            To see all available qualifiers, see our <a class="Link--inTextBlock" href="https://docs.github.com/search-github/github-code-search/understanding-github-code-search-syntax">documentation</a>.
          </p>
</form>        </div>

        <div data-target="custom-scopes.manageCustomScopesForm">
          <div data-target="custom-scopes.list"></div>
        </div>

</div>
      </scrollable-region>
      <div data-view-component="true" class="Overlay-footer Overlay-footer--alignEnd Overlay-footer--divided">          <button data-action="click:custom-scopes#customScopesCancel" type="button" data-view-component="true" class="btn">    Cancel
</button>
          <button form="custom-scopes-dialog-form" data-action="click:custom-scopes#customScopesSubmit" data-target="custom-scopes.customScopesSubmitButton" type="submit" data-view-component="true" class="btn-primary btn">    Create saved search
</button>
</div>
</dialog></dialog-helper>
    </custom-scopes>
  </div>
</qbsearch-input>

    <path d="M7.467.133a1.748 1.748 0 0 1 1.066 0l5.25 1.68A1.75 1.75 0 0 1 15 3.48V7c0 1.566-.32 3.182-1.303 4.682-.983 1.498-2.585 2.813-5.032 3.855a1.697 1.697 0 0 1-1.33 0c-2.447-1.042-4.049-2.357-5.032-3.855C1.32 10.182 1 8.566 1 7V3.48a1.75 1.75 0 0 1 1.217-1.667Zm.61 1.429a.25.25 0 0 0-.153 0l-5.25 1.68a.25.25 0 0 0-.174.238V7c0 1.358.275 2.666 1.057 3.86.784 1.194 2.121 2.34 4.366 3.297a.196.196 0 0 0 .154 0c2.245-.956 3.582-2.104 4.366-3.298C13.225 9.666 13.5 8.36 13.5 7V3.48a.251.251 0 0 0-.174-.237l-5.25-1.68ZM8.75 4.75v3a.75.75 0 0 1-1.5 0v-3a.75.75 0 0 1 1.5 0ZM9 10.5a1 1 0 1 1-2 0 1 1 0 0 1 2 0Z"></path>
</svg>
        </span>
      
        <span data-view-component="true" class="ActionListItem-label">
          Security
</span>      
</a>
  
</li>
        <li hidden="hidden" data-menu-item="i7insights-tab" data-targets="action-list.items" role="none" data-view-component="true" class="ActionListItem">
    
    
    <a tabindex="-1" id="item-b16384e8-4f3c-4617-a6a9-d9b67dac9e63" href="/a2aproject/A2A/pulse" role="menuitem" data-view-component="true" class="ActionListContent ActionListContent--visual16">
        <span class="ActionListItem-visual ActionListItem-visual--leading">
          <svg aria-hidden="true" height="16" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" data-view-component="true" class="octicon octicon-graph">

        </span>

          Insights

The A2A Python SDK provides an abstract base class \u003ccode\u003ea2a.server.agent_execution.AgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e that you implement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e Interface\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-agentexecutor-interface\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: AgentExecutor Interface\" href=\"#agentexecutor-interface\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e class defines two primary methods:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003easync def execute(self, context: RequestContext, event_queue: EventQueue)\u003c/code\u003e: Handles incoming requests that expect a response or a stream of events. It processes the user's input (available via \u003ccode\u003econtext\u003c/code\u003e) and uses the \u003ccode\u003eevent_queue\u003c/code\u003e to send back \u003ccode\u003eMessage\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTaskStatusUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e, or \u003ccode\u003eTaskArtifactUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e objects.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003easync def cancel(self, context: RequestContext, event_queue: EventQueue)\u003c/code\u003e: Handles requests to cancel an ongoing task.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eRequestContext\u003c/code\u003e provides information about the incoming request, such as the user's message and any existing task details. The \u003ccode\u003eEventQueue\u003c/code\u003e is used by the executor to send events back to the client.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eHelloworld Agent Executor\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-helloworld-agent-executor\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Helloworld Agent Executor\" href=\"#helloworld-agent-executor\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eLet's look at \u003ccode\u003eagent_executor.py\u003c/code\u003e. It defines \u003ccode\u003eHelloWorldAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Agent (\u003ccode\u003eHelloWorldAgent\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e:\nThis is a simple helper class that encapsulates the actual \"business logic\".\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight \u003ccode\u003eAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e interface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/agent_executor.py:HelloWorldAgentExecutor_execute\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen a \u003ccode\u003emessage/send\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003emessage/stream\u003c/code\u003e request comes in (both are handled by \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e in this simplified executor):\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt calls \u003ccode\u003eself.agent.invoke()\u003c/code\u003e to get the \"Hello World\" string.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt creates an A2A \u003ccode\u003eMessage\u003c/code\u003e object using the \u003ccode\u003enew_agent_text_message\u003c/code\u003e utility function.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt enqueues this message onto the \u003ccode\u003eevent_queue\u003c/code\u003e. The underlying \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e will then process this queue to send the response(s) to the client. For a single message like this, it will result in a single response for \u003ccode\u003emessage/send\u003c/code\u003e or a single event for \u003ccode\u003emessage/stream\u003c/code\u003e before the stream closes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecancel\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e:\nThe Hello World example's \u003ccode\u003ecancel\u003c/code\u003e method simply raises an exception, indicating that cancellation is not supported for this basic agent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/agent_executor.py:HelloWorldAgentExecutor_cancel\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/agent_executor.py:HelloWorldAgentExecutor_cancel\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e acts as the bridge between the A2A protocol (managed by the request handler and server application) and your agent's specific logic. It receives context about the request and uses an event queue to communicate results or updates back.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/article\u003e","renderedFileInfo":null,"shortPath":null,"symbolsEnabled":true,"tabSize":4,"topBannersInfo":{"overridingGlobalFundingFile":false,"globalPreferredFundingPath":null,"showInvalidCitationWarning":false,"citationHelpUrl":"https://docs.github.com/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/creating-a-repository-on-github/about-citation-files","actionsOnboardingTip":null},"truncated":false,"viewable":true,"workflowRedirectUrl":null,"symbols":{"timed_out":false,"not_analyzed":false,"symbols":[{"name":"4.   <h2 class="sr-only">Navigation Menu</h2>

  <button type="button" class="HeaderMktg-backdrop d-lg-none border-0 position-fixed top-0 left-0 width-full height-full js-details-target" aria-label="Toggle navigation">

        <span class="js-stale-session-flash-switched" hidden>You switched accounts on another tab or window. <a class="Link--inTextBlock" href="">Reload</a> to refresh your session.</span>

    <button id="icon-button-a9acfb75-18fb-42bb-bbe0-8ce90d14ef11" aria-labelledby="tooltip-943e636b-1056-4878-949d-ef5c68b6c6f5" type="button" data-view-component="true" class="Button Button--iconOnly Button--invisible Button--medium flash-close js-flash-close">  <svg aria-hidden="true" height="16" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" data-view-component="true" class="octicon octicon-x Button-visual">
    <path d="M3.72 3.72a.75.75 0 0 1 1.06 0L8 6.94l3.22-3.22a.749.749 0 0 1 1.275.326.749.749 0 0 1-.215.734L9.06 8l3.22 3.22a.749.749 0 0 1-.326 1.275.749.749 0 0 1-.734-.215L8 9.06l-3.22 3.22a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042L6.94 8 3.72 4.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06Z"></path>

</div>
    </div>

It uses \u003ca href=\"https://www.starlette.io/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eStarlette\u003c/a\u003e for the web framework and is typically run with an ASGI server like \u003ca href=\"https://www.uvicorn.org/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eUvicorn\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eLet's look at \u003ccode\u003e__main__.py\u003c/code\u003e again to see how the server is initialized and started.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/__main__.py\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/__main__.py\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eLet's break this down:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe SDK provides \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e. This handler takes your \u003ccode\u003eAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e implementation (here, \u003ccode\u003eHelloWorldAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e) and a \u003ccode\u003eTaskStore\u003c/code\u003e (here, \u003ccode\u003eInMemoryTaskStore\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt routes incoming A2A RPC calls to the appropriate methods on your executor (like \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003ecancel\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eTaskStore\u003c/code\u003e is used by the \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e to manage the lifecycle of tasks, especially for stateful interactions, streaming, and resubscription. Even if your agent executor is simple, the handler needs a task store.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003eA2AStarletteApplication\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eA2AStarletteApplication\u003c/code\u003e class is instantiated with the \u003ccode\u003eagent_card\u003c/code\u003e and the \u003ccode\u003erequest_handler\u003c/code\u003e (referred to as \u003ccode\u003ehttp_handler\u003c/code\u003e in its constructor).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eagent_card\u003c/code\u003e is crucial because the server will expose it at the \u003ccode\u003e/.well-known/agent-card.json\u003c/code\u003e endpoint (by default).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003erequest_handler\u003c/code\u003e is responsible for processing all incoming A2A method calls by interacting with your \u003ccode\u003eAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ccode\u003euvicorn.run(server_app_builder.build(), ...)\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eA2AStarletteApplication\u003c/code\u003e has a \u003ccode\u003ebuild()\u003c/code\u003e method that constructs the actual Starlette application.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis application is then run using \u003ccode\u003euvicorn.run()\u003c/code\u003e, making your agent accessible over HTTP.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ehost='0.0.0.0'\u003c/code\u003e makes the server accessible on all network interfaces on your machine.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eport=9999\u003c/code\u003e specifies the port to listen on. This matches the \u003ccode\u003eurl\u003c/code\u003e in the \u003ccode\u003eAgentCard\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cdiv         <div class="position-relative">
                <ul
                  role="listbox"
                  class="ActionListWrap QueryBuilder-ListWrap"
                  aria-label="Suggestions"
                  data-action="
                    combobox-commit:query-builder#comboboxCommit
                    mousedown:query-builder#resultsMousedown
                  "
                  data-target="query-builder.resultsList"
                  data-persist-list=false
                  id="query-builder-test-results"
                  tabindex="-1"
                ></ul>
        </div>
      <div class="FormControl-inlineValidation" id="validation-da7345bd-a342-4c43-b230-0defc3ed19e0" hidden="hidden">

class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eUnderstanding the Client Code\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-understanding-the-client-code\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Understanding the Client Code\" href=\"#understanding-the-client-code\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eLet's look at key parts of \u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFetching the Agent Card \u0026amp; Initializing the Client\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/test_client.py:A2ACardResolver\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/test_client.py:A2ACardResolver\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eA2ACardResolver\u003c/code\u003e class is a convenience. It first fetches the \u003ccode\u003eAgentCard\u003c/code\u003e from the server's \u003ccode\u003e/.well-known/agent-card.json\u003c/code\u003e endpoint (based on the provided base URL) and then initializes the client with it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSending a Non-Streaming Message (\u003ccode\u003esend_message\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/test_client.py:send_message\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/test_client.py:send_message\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003esend_message_payload\u003c/code\u003e constructs the data for \u003ccode\u003eMessageSendParams\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis is wrapped in a \u003ccode\u003eSendMessageRequest\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt includes a \u003ccode\u003emessage\u003c/code\u003e object with the \u003ccode\u003erole\u003c/code\u003e set to \"user\" and the content in \u003ccode\u003eparts\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Helloworld agent's \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e method will enqueue a single \"Hello World\" message. The \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e will retrieve this and send it as the response.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eresponse\u003c/code\u003e will be a \u003ccode\u003eSendMessageResponse\u003c/code\u003e object, which contains either a \u003ccode\u003eSendMessageSuccessResponse\u003c/code\u003e (with the agent's \u003ccode\u003eMessage\u003c/code\u003e as the result) or a \u003ccode\u003eJSONRPCErrorResponse\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHandling Task IDs (Illustrative Note for Helloworld)\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe Helloworld client (\u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e) doesn't attempt \u003ccode\u003eget_task\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003ecancel_task\u003c/code\u003e directly because the simple Helloworld agent's \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e method, when called via \u003ccode\u003emessage/send\u003c/code\u003e, results in the \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e returning a direct \u003ccode\u003eMessage\u003c/code\u003e response rather than a \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e object. More complex agents that explicitly manage tasks (like the LangGraph example) would return a \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e object from \u003ccode\u003emessage/send\u003c/code\u003e, and its \u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e could then be used for \u003ccode\u003eget_task\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003ecancel_task\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSending a Streaming Message (\u003ccode\u003esend_message_streaming\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/test_client.py:send_message_streaming\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/helloworld/test_client.py:send_message_streaming\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis method calls the agent's \u003ccode\u003emessage/stream\u003c/code\u003e endpoint. The \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e will invoke the \u003ccode\u003eHelloWorldAgentExecutor.execute\u003c/code\u003e method.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e method enqueues one \"Hello World\" message, and then the event queue is closed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe client will receive this single message as one \u003ccode\u003eSendStreamingMessageResponse\u003c/code\u003e event, and then the stream will terminate.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003estream_response\u003c/code\u003e is an \u003ccode\u003eAsyncGenerator\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eExpected Output\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-expected-output\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Expected Output\" href=\"#expected-output\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen you run \u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e, you'll see JSON outputs for:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe non-streaming response (a single \"Hello World\" message).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe streaming response (a single \"Hello World\" message as one chunk, after which the stream ends).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e fields in the output will vary with each run.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"// Non-streaming response\n{\u0026quot;jsonrpc\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;2.0\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;id\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;xxxxxxxx\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;result\u0026quot;:{\u0026quot;type\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;message\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;role\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;agent\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;parts\u0026quot;:[{\u0026quot;type\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;text\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;text\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;Hello World\u0026quot;}],\u0026quot;messageId\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;yyyyyyyy\u0026quot;}}\n// Streaming response (one chunk)\n{\u0026quot;jsonrpc\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;2.0\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;id\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;zzzzzzzz\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;result\u0026quot;:{\u0026quot;type\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;message\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;role\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;agent\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;parts\u0026quot;:[{\u0026quot;type\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;text\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;text\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;Hello World\u0026quot;}],\u0026quot;messageId\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;wwwwwwww\u0026quot;,\u0026quot;final\u0026quot;:true}}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e// Non-streaming response\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e{\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\",\"id\":\"xxxxxxxx\",\"result\":{\"type\":\"message\",\"role\":\"agent\",\"parts\":[{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Hello World\"}],\"messageId\":\"yyyyyyyy\"}}\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e// Streaming response (one chunk)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e{\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\",\"id\":\"zzzzzzzz\",\"result\":{\"type\":\"message\",\"role\":\"agent\",\"parts\":[{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Hello World\"}],\"messageId\":\"wwwwwwww\",\"final\":true}}\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e(Actual IDs like \u003ccode\u003exxxxxxxx\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eyyyyyyyy\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ezzzzzzzz\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ewwwwwwww\u003c/code\u003e will be different UUIDs/request IDs)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis confirms your server is correctly handling basic A2A interactions with the updated SDK structure!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNow you can shut down the server by typing Ctrl+C in the terminal window where \u003ccode\u003e__main__.py\u003c/code\u003e is running.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/article\u003e","renderedFileInfo":null,"shortPath":null,"symbolsEnabled":true,"tabSize":4,"topBannersInfo":{"overridingGlobalFundingFile":false,"globalPreferredFundingPath":null,"showInvalidCitationWarning":false,"citationHelpUrl":"https://docs.github.com/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/creating-a-repository-on-github/about-citation-files","actionsOnboardingTip":null},"truncated":false,"viewable":true,"workflowRedirectUrl":null,"symbols":{"timed_out":false,"not_analyzed":false,"symbols":[{"name":"6.   <cookie-consent-link>
    <button
      type="button"
      class="Link--secondary underline-on-hover border-0 p-0 color-bg-transparent text-left"

      data-analytics-event="{&quot;location&quot;:&quot;footer&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:&quot;dont_share_info&quot;,&quot;context&quot;:&quot;subfooter&quot;,&quot;tag&quot;:&quot;link&quot;,&quot;label&quot;:&quot;dont_share_info_link_subfooter_footer&quot;}"
    >
      Do not share my personal information
    </button>
  </cookie-consent-link>
</li>

      </ul>
    </nav>
  </div>
</footer>

\u003ccode\u003elangchain-google-genai\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003elanggraph\u003c/code\u003e. When you installed the SDK from the \u003ccode\u003ea2a-samples\u003c/code\u003e root using \u003ccode\u003epip install -e .[dev]\u003c/code\u003e, this should have also installed the dependencies for the workspace examples, including \u003ccode\u003elanggraph-example\u003c/code\u003e. 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003elanggraph\u003c/code\u003e example showcases several important A2A concepts:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLLM Integration\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eagent.py\u003c/code\u003e defines \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgent\u003c/code\u003e. It uses \u003ccode\u003eChatGoogleGenerativeAI\u003c/code\u003e and LangGraph's \u003ccode\u003ecreate_react_agent\u003c/code\u003e to process user queries.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis demonstrates how a real LLM can power the agent's logic.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTask State Management\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003esamples/langgraph/__main__.py\u003c/code\u003e initializes a \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e with an \u003ccode\u003eInMemoryTaskStore\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"--8\u0026lt;-- \u0026quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/langgraph/app/__main__.py:DefaultRequestHandler\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e8\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e\u0026lt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/refs/heads/main/samples/python/agents/langgraph/app/__main__.py:DefaultRequestHandler\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e (in \u003ccode\u003esamples/langgraph/agent_executor.py\u003c/code\u003e), when its \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e method is called by the \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e, interacts with the \u003ccode\u003eRequestContext\u003c/code\u003e which contains the current task (if any).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor \u003ccode\u003emessage/send\u003c/code\u003e, the \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e uses the \u003ccode\u003eTaskStore\u003c/code\u003e to persist and retrieve task state across interactions. The response to \u003ccode\u003emessage/send\u003c/code\u003e will be a full \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e object if the agent's execution flow involves multiple steps or results in a persistent task.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e's \u003ccode\u003erun_single_turn_test\u003c/code\u003e demonstrates getting a \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e object back and then querying it using \u003ccode\u003eget_task\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStreaming with \u003ccode\u003eTaskStatusUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTaskArtifactUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e method in \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e is responsible for handling both non-streaming and streaming requests, orchestrated by the \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAs the LangGraph agent processes the request (which might involve calling tools like \u003ccode\u003eget_exchange_rate\u003c/code\u003e), the \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e enqueues different types of events onto the \u003ccode\u003eEventQueue\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTaskStatusUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e: For intermediate updates (e.g., \"Looking up exchange rates...\", \"Processing the exchange rates..\"). The \u003ccode\u003efinal\u003c/code\u003e flag on these events is \u003ccode\u003eFalse\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTaskArtifactUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e: When the final answer is ready, it's enqueued as an artifact. The \u003ccode\u003elastChunk\u003c/code\u003e flag is \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA final \u003ccode\u003eTaskStatusUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003estate=TaskState.completed\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003efinal=True\u003c/code\u003e is sent to signify the end of the task for streaming.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e's \u003ccode\u003erun_streaming_test\u003c/code\u003e function will print these individual event chunks as they are received from the server.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMulti-Turn Conversation (\u003ccode\u003eTaskState.input_required\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgent\u003c/code\u003e can ask for clarification if a query is ambiguous (e.g., user asks \"how much is 100 USD?\").\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWhen this happens, the \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e will enqueue a \u003ccode\u003eTaskStatusUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e where \u003ccode\u003estatus.state\u003c/code\u003e is \u003ccode\u003eTaskState.input_required\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003estatus.message\u003c/code\u003e contains the agent's question (e.g., \"To which currency would you like to convert?\"). This event will have \u003ccode\u003efinal=True\u003c/code\u003e for the current interaction stream.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e's \u003ccode\u003erun_multi_turn_test\u003c/code\u003e function demonstrates this:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIt sends an initial ambiguous query.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe agent responds (via the \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e processing the enqueued events) with a \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e whose status is \u003ccode\u003einput_required\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe client then sends a second message, including the \u003ccode\u003etaskId\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003econtextId\u003c/code\u003e from the first turn's \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e response, to provide the missing information (\"in GBP\"). This continues the same task.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eExploring the Code\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-exploring-the-code\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Exploring the Code\" href=\"#exploring-the-code\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTake some time to look through these files:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e__main__.py\u003c/code\u003e: Server setup using \u003ccode\u003eA2AStarletteApplication\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eDefaultRequestHandler\u003c/code\u003e. Note the \u003ccode\u003eAgentCard\u003c/code\u003e definition includes \u003ccode\u003ecapabilities.streaming=True\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eagent.py\u003c/code\u003e: The \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgent\u003c/code\u003e with LangGraph, LLM model, and tool definitions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eagent_executor.py\u003c/code\u003e: The \u003ccode\u003eCurrencyAgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e implementing the \u003ccode\u003eexecute\u003c/code\u003e (and \u003ccode\u003ecancel\u003c/code\u003e) method. It uses the \u003ccode\u003eRequestContext\u003c/code\u003e to understand the ongoing task and the \u003ccode\u003eEventQueue\u003c/code\u003e to send back various events (\u003ccode\u003eTaskStatusUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTaskArtifactUpdateEvent\u003c/code\u003e, new \u003ccode\u003eTask\u003c/code\u003e object implicitly via the first event if no task exists).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etest_client.py\u003c/code\u003e: Demonstrates various interaction patterns, including retrieving task IDs and using them for multi-turn conversations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis example provides a much richer illustration of how A2A facilitates complex, stateful, and asynchronous interactions between agents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/article\u003e","renderedFileInfo":null,"shortPath":null,"symbolsEnabled":true,"tabSize":4,"topBannersInfo":{"overridingGlobalFundingFile":false,"globalPreferredFundingPath":null,"showInvalidCitationWarning":false,"citationHelpUrl":"https://docs.github.com/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/creating-a-repository-on-github/about-citation-files","actionsOnboardingTip":null},"truncated":false,"viewable":true,"workflowRedirectUrl":null,"symbols":{"timed_out":false,"not_analyzed":false,"symbols":[{"name":"7. dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou now have a solid foundation for building and integrating your own A2A-compliant agents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhere to Go From Here?\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-where-to-go-from-here\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Where to Go From Here?\" href=\"#where-to-go-from-here\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eHere are some ideas and resources to continue your A2A journey:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExplore Other Examples:\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCheck out the other examples in the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/a2aproject/a2a-samples/tree/main/samples\"\u003ea2a-samples GitHub repository\u003c/a\u003e for more complex agent integrations and features.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeepen Your Protocol Understanding:\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e📚 Read the complete \u003ca href=\"https://a2a-protocol.org\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eA2A Protocol Documentation site\u003c/a\u003e for a comprehensive overview.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e📝 Review the detailed \u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/specification.md\"\u003eA2A Protocol Specification\u003c/a\u003e to understand the nuances of all data structures and RPC methods.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eReview Key A2A Topics:\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/topics/a2a-and-mcp.md\"\u003eA2A and MCP\u003c/a\u003e: Understand how A2A complements the Model Context Protocol for tool usage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/topics/enterprise-ready.md\"\u003eEnterprise-Ready Features\u003c/a\u003e: Learn about security, observability, and other enterprise considerations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/topics/streaming-and-async.md\"\u003eStreaming \u0026amp; Asynchronous Operations\u003c/a\u003e: Get more details on SSE and push notifications.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/docs/topics/agent-discovery.md\"\u003eAgent Discovery\u003c/a\u003e: Explore different ways agents can find each other.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBuild Your Own Agent:\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTry creating a new A2A agent using your favorite Python agent framework (like LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen, Semantic Kernel, or a custom solution).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImplement the \u003ccode\u003ea2a.server.AgentExecutor\u003c/code\u003e interface to bridge your agent's logic with the A2A protocol.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThink about what unique skills your agent could offer and how its Agent Card would represent them.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExperiment with Advanced Features:\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImplement robust task management with a persistent \u003ccode\u003eTaskStore\u003c/code\u003e if your agent handles long-running or multi-session tasks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExplore implementing push notifications if your agent's tasks are very long-lived.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConsider more complex input and output modalities (e.g., handling file uploads/downloads, or structured data via \u003ccode\u003eDataPart\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eContribute to the A2A Community:\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eJoin the discussions on the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/a2aproject/A2A/discussions\"\u003eA2A GitHub Discussions page\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReport issues or suggest improvements via \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/a2aproject/A2A/issues\"\u003eGitHub Issues\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConsider contributing code, examples, or documentation. See the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md\"\u003eCONTRIBUTING.md\u003c/a\u003e guide.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe A2A protocol aims to foster an ecosystem of interoperable AI agents. By building and sharing A2A-compliant agents, you can be a part of this exciting         <span data-view-component="true" class="ActionListItem-label">
          Insights
</span>      
</a>
  
</li>
</ul>    
</div></action-list>


</div>
      
</div></anchored-position>  </focus-group>
</action-menu></div>
</nav>

  </div>

    <path d="M6.457 1.047c.659-1.234 2.427-1.234 3.086 0l6.082 11.378A1.75 1.75 0 0 1 14.082 15H1.918a1.75 1.75 0 0 1-1.543-2.575Zm1.763.707a.25.25 0 0 0-.44 0L1.698 13.132a.25.25 0 0 0 .22.368h12.164a.25.25 0 0 0 .22-.368Zm.53 3.996v2.5a.75.75 0 0 1-1.5 0v-2.5a.75.75 0 0 1 1.5 0ZM9 11a1 1 0 1 1-2 0 1 1 0 0 1 2 0Z"></path>

    <button type="button" class="flash-close js-ajax-error-dismiss" aria-label="Dismiss error">
      <svg aria-hidden="true" height="16" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" data-view-component="true" class="octicon octicon-x">

    </button>
    You can’t perform that action at this time.
  </div>

            <a data-analytics-event="{&quot;category&quot;:&quot;Footer&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:&quot;go to community&quot;,&quot;label&quot;:&quot;text:community&quot;}" href="https://github.community/" data-view-component="true" class="Link--secondary Link">Community</a>
          </li>

      class="Link--secondary underline-on-hover border-0 p-0 color-bg-transparent"
      data-action="click:cookie-consent-link#showConsentManagement"
      data-analytics-event="{&quot;location&quot;:&quot;footer&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:&quot;cookies&quot;,&quot;context&quot;:&quot;subfooter&quot;,&quot;tag&quot;:&quot;link&quot;,&quot;label&quot;:&quot;cookies_link_subfooter_footer&quot;}"
    >
       Manage cookies
    </button>
  </cookie-consent-link>
</li>

    >
      Do not share my personal information

  </cookie-consent-link>

      </ul>
    </nav>
  </div>
</footer>

        <div class="position-relative">
                <ul
                  role="listbox"
                  class="ActionListWrap QueryBuilder-ListWrap"
                  aria-label="Suggestions"
                  data-action="
                    combobox-commit:query-builder#comboboxCommit
                    mousedown:query-builder#resultsMousedown
                  "
                  data-target="query-builder.resultsList"
                  data-persist-list=false
                  id="query-builder-test-results"
                  tabindex="-1"
                ></ul>
        </div>
      <div class="FormControl-inlineValidation" id="validation-d7cb592f-4af5-4f66-82de-53d3c0c784bd" hidden="hidden">

  app-name="react-code-view"
  initial-path="/a2aproject/A2A/blob/main/specification/json/README.md"
    style="display: block; min-height: calc(100vh - 64px);"
